isis.stitle: TSI 05-16-07 - 7000 HPV Models Used for Plowing Snow may Experience Snow Blocking the Cowl Tray Fresh Air Intake for the Heating, Ventilating, and Air Conditioning (HVAC) System

subjectgroup.subject: 7000 HPV Models Used for Plowing Snow may Experience Snow Blocking the Cowl Tray Fresh Air Intake for the Heating, Ventilating, and Air Conditioning (HVAC) System

geninfo.para: A cowl tray heater kit is available to minimize snow accumulation over the HVAC air intake vent located on the passenger side of the cowl tray.

entry.para: 512345C1, Bulk Hose, 3/8 I.D. X 11/16 O.D. X 36 Inches Long (3)
512345C1, Bulk Hose, 3/8 I.D. X 11/16 X 48 Inches Long (4)

warning.para: To avoid property damage, personal injury, or death, park the vehicle on a flat level surface, set the parking brake, turn the engine off, and chock the wheels.

To avoid personal injury or death from hot coolant or steam allow the engine to cool. Wrap a thick heavy cloth around the radiator cap, Push down on the cap and slowly turn the cap to the first notch then pause to allow pressure to release through the over flow tube.

step1.para: Drain the radiator coolant into a suitable clean container.
Remove the air cleaner bracket and air cleaner assembly.
Remove the HVAC air intake grille located in the cowl tray on the passenger side.

note.para: If the vehicle being serviced has the optional air cleaner over the air intake grille do not reinstall the optional air cleaner for winter operation. The optional air cleaner should be reinstalled when the supply valve to the cowl tray heater is turned off for warm weather operation.

step1.para: Use the aluminum heater from the kit, as a template to locate two (2) mounting holes on the front of the engine air intake housing as shown in Figure 1. Drill the holes with a 5/16 inch drill bit.

figure.caption: Figure 1. Locate Holes on Front Surface of Housing

calloutgroup.callout1: A. 6 1/4 Inches from Top of Housing
B. 3 1/2 Inches from Edge of Housing

step1.para: On the curb side of the HVAC air intake housing locate two (2) hole positions as shown in Figure 2. Drill the holes with a 3/4 inch drill bit.

figure.caption: Figure 2. Locate Holes on Side of Housing

calloutgroup.callout1: A. 4 Inches from Top of Housing
B. 5 1/4 Inches from Top of Housing
C. 1 Inch from Front Edge of Housing

step1.para: Insert one 3/8 inch I.D X 36 inches long heater hose into one of the drilled holes shown in Figure 2 and a 3/8 inch I.D. X 48 inch long hose into the other hole.

note.para: The heater mounting legs in the following Step must be toward the front of the HVAC air intake housing.

step1.para: From inside the HVAC air intake housing grasp each hose and pull the hose out at the top of the housing. Install a hose clamp over each hose and attach each hose to the cowl tray heater hose fitting. Tighten each hose clamp (Figure 3).

figure.caption: Figure 3. Install Hoses to Heater with Hose Clamps

step1.para: Lower the heater inside the HVAC air intake housing. Place the aluminum plate between the heater mounting legs and the inside housing wall, align the mounting holes, install bolts through the heater legs, the aluminum plate and housing. Install a nut and washer on each bolt and tighten.
Re-install the grille over the HVAC air intake opening (Figure 4).

figure.caption: Figure 4. Re-install HVAC Air Intake Grille

step1.para: Re-install the air cleaner bracket and assembly.
Route the hoses from the HVAC air intake heater between the cowl tray and the air cleaner (Figure 5).

Locate the intake hose at the surge tank from the engine. Cut the surge tank intake hose approximately 6 inches from the tank, install hose clamps and a tee fitting from the kit between the cut surge tank hose ends and install the 3/8 I.D. X 48 inch long hose from the HVAC air intake heater with a hose clamp (Figure 6).

figure.caption: Figure 6. Install Hoses to Tee Fitting (Hose Clamps Not Shown)

calloutgroup.callout1: 2. 3/8 I.D. X 48 Inch Long Hose from Air Intake Heater

step1.para: Locate and cut the cab heater return hose. Install the fitting assembly (Figure 7) from the kit between the cut heater return hose ends and secure the hose ends with hose clamps. Attach the remaining hose from the HVAC air intake heater to the 3/8 inch fitting. Install a hose clamp and tighten (Figure 8).

figure.caption: Figure 7. Cab Heater Return Hose Fitting Assembly

calloutgroup.callout1: 1. Hose Fittings for Cab Heater Return Hose (2590604C1)
1. Install Fitting Assembly in Cab Heater Return Hose
2. Install HVAC Intake Air Heater Hose to 3/8 Inch Hose Fitting

step1.para: Install tie straps, as needed, to secure the hose routing.
Fill the radiator and top off as needed with the appropriate coolant.
